narrative.narrative: Mordovia Airlines, also called the Saransk Air Enterprise, was around from 1992 to February 2013. It was the Saransk division of Aeroflot before becoming independant. Saransk is the capital of the Mordovia Republic region of Russia. Its last schedule had it going from Saransk to Moscow Domodedovo and seasonally to Sochi. It had five Antonov 24's, and RusLike operated Bombardier CRJ100 and CRJ200's on its behalf as well. Its license was revoked due to violating pilots worktime limits and other safety issues.
